Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: AMH 2010 and AMH 2020, or EUH 2000 and EUH 2001, or WOH 2012 and WOH 2022 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: To enhance the role of History professionals in civic life and careers.

HIS3930H - ST: Honors The City as Text.name: HIS3930H - ST: Honors The City as Text

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of theory and history of urban spaces, focusing on Orlando and Central Florida. With Honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines past and present science, scientific thought, and the relationship between science and society.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Practice of public history including historic preservation, museum studies, archival management, oral history, digital history, historical editing, and conservation science.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Past visions of the future and how they were influenced by issues relevant to the period. Emphasis on 19th and 20th centuries.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduces students to the principles, theories and methods related to curating historical objects, content and photos in a modern media environment.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The history of medicine and its relationship to culture and society from the Ancient World to the present.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of European and/or American historiography.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or AMH 2020, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An approach to the human past which investigates and represents the places and spaces in which events occurred, using common spatial storytelling tools.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: "C" or better in HIS 4150 and Senior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: In the term they are graduating, History B.A. students revise their portfolio and submit for approval.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The Public History Internship is a one-semester course in which undergraduate history majors explore and gain experience in public history professions.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: AMH 2010/AMH 2020 sequence, and EUH 2000/EUH 2001 or WOH 2012/WOH 2022 sequence or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduces students to historic preservation practice and theory using domestic and international examples.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theories and practices of oral history. Field work required.
